hobby.message: Any new mods on your FPV quad?
I hear analog photography still survives in your hands.

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Long walk tonight. Streets aren’t empty anymore. Lot of people out since the leaks.
Still managed to squeeze in some drone flying, away from the crowds.
Harder finding quiet airspace these days.
People don’t watch the sky—good for me.
Not the worst path. Sidestepped two checkpoints, nothing serious.
Brought my FPV drone tonight—haven’t risked it much lately.
Whole city’s buzzing since those intervention logs dropped.
Fewer blind spots now for flying, but I still find a way.
Feels like everyone’s looking over their shoulder, even in the old yards.
Decent walk, couple detours around patrols but nothing new.
Used my FPV quad out by Sector 11 earlier—old hobby, keeps my head clear.
Not as quiet with free zone folks crowding the old rail yard.
Had interference on my goggles from Directorate comms—never used to happen.
No one bothered me, which is a change.
Everyone’s a little distracted after those BCI logs hit.
Pretty smooth—no one cares much about checkpoints now, not after those logs dropped.
Spent three hours flying my FPV drone out past the network kill zone.
Whole community out there building radios, burning old compliance bands.
Caught Directorate interference, but channels are empty—system’s lost interest.
Had the sky to myself for once, no sidelong glances.
Haven’t seen that many people cheering a drone in ages.
Honestly, my quad feels less like surveillance, more like freedom.
Easy enough—no one tracks score anymore with everything falling apart.
Drones are my thing. Freestyle FPV, always off-grid—I’m obsessed with staying out of system range.
Used to fly alone at night so BCI score dips wouldn’t flag me.
Lately, the crowds at the yards are bigger—feels safer, weirdly.
Everyone’s ditching old bands, building analog comms.
Two days back, Directorate chatter just sputtered out mid-flight. System’s off-balance, same as us.
Got my best reaction ever—kids cheering, waving up at the cam feed.
Feels like for the first time, the city’s ours down there, not theirs.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still flying when I can.
Not much space left these days.
Too many people watching after the leaks.
Last time, interference made things unpredictable.
I keep it quiet now.
Yeah, still out dodging towers.
Some zones are riskier since Halden’s files dropped.
People notice if I linger now.
Drone signals get weird interference lately.
Fewer eyes, but more tension in the air.
I fly short sessions.
Still flying drones. Keeps my head on straight.
Sector 11’s less patrolled since the comms blackout.
Crowds gather, ignore their scores now.
Once, I picked up Directorate static mid-flight.
Security’s absent, but you feel the system fraying.
Drones don’t care. That’s the draw for me.
Next time might be different.
Still weaving through towers whenever I get the chance.
Sector 11’s become a free zone this week—nobody checks BCI scores.
Whole scene’s changed. Kids run analog gear, folks burn their bands.
Caught some Directorate static bleeding into my video feed last time.
Security never showed. Unnerving, but freeing too.
People wave at the drone. No one’s hiding anymore.
Even I felt anonymous for a bit.
That’s rare now.
Yeah. Still my main escape—it’s better than therapy.
Been flying in Sector 11’s free zone lately.
Used to be risky, now everyone’s out. They ditch their bands, ignore scores.
Last flight, caught old Directorate comms in my goggles. System’s leaking at the seams.
Nobody stops us. Security feels absent on purpose.
People build their own transmitters, share food, watch my FPV loops like it’s theater.
For a few hours there’s no control—just noise and connection.
I started with drones after my brother vanished.
Staying off the system’s grid is the only thing that makes sense now.
